ratings.comment: Excellent online course, especially for those who are not science majors and have intense course loads. The material is interesting and applicable to everday life, and the test are beyond easy. More than half of each test is comprised of matching questions! Also the extra credit for taking the practice tests makes it easy to get a good grade.

Class content was very interesting, but I was disappointed in my interactions with the professor. As a returning adult student, I found her to be not only inflexible, but rude in her responses to my questions.

Great class with a great professor.  I took it online and all of her lectures were VERY clear and organized.  Just take notes from the lectures and study them (and make sure you keep up with your work). There are 16 points total of extra credit up for grabs and all you have to do is take practice exams (which in turn help you study for the exams).
I am baffled at anyone who thinks this class is hard. She gives up to 16 points of extra credit, and I don't think you can get much easier than that.
not an easy A- when people say this class is easy, its the material they are talking about. However the tests are hard and making yourself do the work doesnt always happen.

Online makes it convenient and easy. Overall, if you study and do the online lectures you should pull off a good grade. Little work is needed and only 4 exams; no papers or quizes. Extra credit available too.

Took online class. The material is both very interesting and applicable to your life!! The only problem is, since its online, it's way too easy to slack off, and not view the lectres/readings until just days before the midterms and final, if at all. That's what I did, but sill pulled a C. I highly recommend this class, but treat it as a real class!

Online class.  Exams are very similar to practice exams.  Be sure to read the readings (maybe 10 pages a week) because she will put questions on the exam about them.  You also learn a lot about the food you eat everyday :)
Good professor.  She teaches material that is useful in everyday food choices.  I recommend the class.  Offers great opportunities for extra credit too.

the concepts are not hard at all, just a lot of memorizing. harder to get an A than expected but still overall an easy class, didnt require much work. online lectures are boring. the readings are worse
Information was rather interesting, but the online lectures could get extremely boring.  Tests were farily easy, but do require a lot of studying for an A.

The tests were ridiculous and the class required way more studying than you would expect. She was terrible at emphasizing what was important and went way to into detail with test questions. Do not take it unless you have to.

Class was fairly easy, but BORING.  Professor tended to drone on and on and on.  Cheesy videos, obnoxious voice, in all honesty, I personally cannot stand her.  I spent all my time screaming at my computer, and was beyond thrilled when lectures were less than 50 minutes. Thank goodness it's over!!!
Awful class, horrible lay out online and her lectures and readings are very contradictory...DONT TAKE WASTE UR TIME AND KILL YOUR GPA with her impossible tests...
This is the most pointless subject ever.  Don't take this class the tests are way harder than they should be.
Horrible teacher. Do not take this class!

don't let people fool you, you still need to study because the tests get real specific.  a good run through of the online lectures and an info jot down on the study guide will get you a C and a BC with the extra credit but you'll need to spend a good whole night with this material or you won't do much better than that me.

I don't know about everyone else, but I was taking this class just to fill a science credit and I got more than I bargained for. Tests are DETAIL-SPECIFIC, she's awful at emphasizing what's important and what you don't need to write down, and exams took place WAY after we covered the relevant material. If you take this, STUDY A LOT and GOOD LUCK!
one of the easiest classes ever. right up there with AOS 100, math 211, and english 100.
really good professor.  you do have to spend time on the material, but it's not too difficult.  extra credit offered!

Her expectations are pretty clear, but the material was more difficult than I expected it to be.  As long as you study for the exams, you should be fine...but definitely not an easy A without work.  Besides lectures, though, there isn't much work outside of class, so it's not too bad.  She's very nice and enjoyable, too.
Easy and usually intersting.  I learned a lot of health things that I now apply to everyday life.
No Comments

I took the off campus version. You can watch lectrues whenever you want on the computer through learn@uw. So, you don't have to watch them on tv. Other than that, it is an easy A. I liked the class, and I thought it was interesting.

Tests were tricky and included obscure material, but if you do all the extra credit, and actually watch the lectures, you'll get an A.  She is an alright prof., pretty straightforward.  Subject is boring and not very useful, though.

BORING - very tempting to skip considering its on TV. She's not very helpful with things either...many times she's said stuff wont be on the test and there's a huge section about it. TA's were good...take the extra credit tests, youll need them.
The profesor is not very helpful or kind.  However, the two TA's are pretty good.
The most boring waste of 3 credits, except that it fills Biological Science credit. I HATED this class, but she wasn't too bad. She at least seemed to know what she was talking about.
Excellent class.  Take the video version, which you can watch online.  Do the extra credit quizzes and a little studying and the A is yours.  She does a great job presenting the material.
Dreadful excuse for a professor. Painful lectures and useless subject
